channel.title: Tohubohu Producer Podcast
channel.description: We produce professional-quality independent entertainment, always viewing financial and scheduling constraints as opportunities rather than obstacles.
channel.itunes:subtitle: An insider's look at the chaotic world of indie digital filmmaking
channel.itunes:summary: We produce professional-quality independent entertainment, always viewing financial and scheduling constraints as opportunities rather than obstacles.
channel.itunes:author: Tohubohu Productions

image.title: Tohubohu Producer Podcast
image.description: The official podcast for Tohubohu Productions

item.title: Episode 9 - The Relaunch
item.description: In this episode, first airing November 1, 2011, we'll talk about what we've been watching recently, an awards ceremony and a film festival to look for this month, and the top ten essentials any filmmaker needs to tackle the 48 Hour Film Project. If you run into any problems (or have any suggestions), please don't hesitate to drop us a line at podcast@tohubohu.tv, or visit our website at www.tohubohu.tv.
item.itunes:subtitle: The official relaunch of the Tohubohu Producer Podcast, with hosts William R. Coughlan and Bjorn Munson

item.title: Episode 8 - Commentary on "All Roads Lead Away"
item.description:
The commentary track for "All Roads Lead Away," produced in May of 2008. This commentary features executive producer/director William R. Coughlan and D.P. Adam Young.

If you're watching along with the movie, the podcast should start at the same time as the movie's playback track (whether you're watching on DVD or online via QuickTime). If you run into any problems (or have any suggestions), please don't hesitate to drop us a line at podcast@tohubohu.tv, or visit our website at www.tohubohu.tv.
item.itunes:subtitle: Commentary track for the short film "All Roads Lead Away," available for viewing at www.tohubohu.tv

item.title: Episode 5 - 48HFP Update and Camera Rigs
item.description:
We're back! Technically, this is the fifth entry in the Tohubohu Productions Producer Podcast, but let's be honest. The last three were prerecorded commentary tracks. Valuable and educational, perhaps (and not available to the general public before now), but not exactly original. So at last we've got some new content for you.

This time, your host William Coughlan is joined by longtime Tohubohu storyboard artist and D.P. Adam Young. Topics include the latest team updates and some information on the tools of the no-budget indie trade, specifically Dan Selakovich's book "Killer Camera Rigs That you Can Build."
item.itunes:subtitle: Wherein William R. Coughlan and Adam Young provide updates on the 48 Hour Film Project and discuss homemade camera rigs
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Episode 1 - An Admittedly Chaotic Introduction
item.description:
Here it is! The introductory podcast for Tohubohu Productions, as recorded by Tohubohu veteran director/producer William R. Coughlan. Yes, it's cheesy. Yes, it's unpolished and unedited. But that's what makes it real, right?

Right?

Okay, so we're not buying it either.

Just give it a listen and stay tuned. They'll get better. We promise.

In this episode: A brief introduction and an announcement of our plans to enter the 2006 48 Hour Film project.
item.itunes:subtitle: Wherein director/producer William R. Coughlan feebly attempts to provide the basics
item.itunes:summary:

Right?
Okay, so we're not buying it either.
Just give it a listen and stay tuned. They'll get better. We promise.
In this episode: A brief introduction and an announcement of our plans to enter the 2006 48 Hour Film project.
